question: What is the short title of the rules issued under the Income Tax Ordinance, 1984?
contexts: 1. Short title. — These rules may be called the Income Tax Rules, 1984.

question: Who is defined as a "defaulter" in the Income Tax Rules, 1984?
answer: The assessee mentioned in the certificate
contexts: (b) "defaulter" means the assessee mentioned in the certificate;
ground_truth: The assessee mentioned in the certificate

question: Which professionals must maintain accounts in Form A(1) as per Rule 8?
answer: Medical practitioners such as doctors, surgeons, physicians, dentists, psychiatrists, homeopaths, tabibs, vaids, veterinary surgeons
contexts: accounts shall be maintained by medical practitioners, whether known as doctors, surgeons, physicians, dentists, psychiatrists, homeopaths, tabibs, vaids, veterinary surgeons
ground_truth: Medical practitioners such as doctors, surgeons, physicians, dentists, psychiatrists, homeopaths, tabibs, vaids, veterinary surgeons

question: What form must legal practitioners use to maintain their case register?
contexts: Form A (2) CASE REGISTER [To be maintained by legal practitioners...]

question: When must the accounts specified in Rule 8 be maintained from?
answer: From the income years beginning on or after the first day of July, 1984
contexts: (6) The accounts in the forms specified in sub-rule(1) shall be maintained with effect from the income years beginning on or after the first day of July, 1984.
ground_truth: From the income years beginning on or after the first day of July, 1984

question: Under what condition must a house property owner maintain a bank account under Rule 8A?
answer: If they receive more than Tk 25,000 per month in rent
contexts: where any person... receives any sum or aggregate of sums exceeding taka 25,000/- per month... shall maintain a bank account
ground_truth: If they receive more than Tk 25,000 per month in rent

question: What rate of tax is deducted from contractors under Rule 16 when payment exceeds Tk 25 lakh but not Tk 3 crore?
contexts: 5. Where the payment exceeds taka 25,00,000 (twenty five lakh) but does not exceed taka 3,00,00,000 (three crore) 4%

question: What is the tax collection rate for import of crude petroleum oils under Rule 17A?
answer: 2% on the value of imported goods
contexts: (b) two per cent on the value of the imported goods in the case of import of goods specified below: (1) Petroleum oils and oils obtained from bituminous minerals, crude

question: Which authority collects tax on export of manpower under Rule 17C?
answer: Director General, Bureau of Manpower, Employment and Training
contexts: the Director General, Bureau of manpower, Employment and Training shall... collect tax... on account of export of manpower
ground_truth: Director General, Bureau of Manpower, Employment and Training

question: What percentage is collected as advance tax on public auction sales under Rule 17D?
contexts: shall collect... as advance tax from the auction purchaser [at the rate of 5%] of the sale price

question: When must tax deducted at source be paid to the Government under Rule 13?
answer: Within two weeks from the end of the month of deduction
contexts: All sums deducted... shall be paid to the credit of the Government within [two weeks from the end of the month]
ground_truth: Within two weeks from the end of the month of deduction

question: Who must issue a certificate of tax deduction under Rule 18?
contexts: All paying authorities shall issue a certificate as required under section 58 of the Ordinance

question: What is the threshold for annual interest reporting under Rule 20?
contexts: in respect of amounts of interest... exceeding taka 1 [15,000]

contexts: IT - 11GA FORM OF RETURN OF INCOME... FOR INDIVIDUAL AND OTHER TAXPAYERS

question: Under Rule 25AAAA, which taxpayers are exempt from submitting a Statement of Assets & Liabilities?
answer: Individual taxpayers whose total income from business or profession does not exceed Tk 3 lakh in the income year.
ground_truth: Individuals with business income ≤ Tk 3 lakh.
